bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Estela Agramonte Rodriguez Leon, August 16, 1941

div1.p: Hench writes that he has identified the men in the 1901 photograph.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Estela Agramonte Rodriguez Leon, August 16, 1941
div1.p:
You may remember the copy of the photograph
which you loaned me of the Commission of Infectious
Diseases, Mariel, 1901, Pinar del Rio. I showed it
to General Kean and General Truby but they could not
help me. I also sent a copy to Dr. Albertini and
he has just sent me the following information which I
know you will be glad to have. I must confess I did not
recognize Dr. Albertini as the man in the middle nor did
I recognize Dr. Dominguez as the man on the left. I met
him but of course he has changed greatly in his appearance.

“I wish to acknowledge receipt of the photograph
which I am returning to you. This picture was taken forty
years ago and seems to be of interest since prominent physi-
cians already gone are depictured. From left to right I have
been able to recognize, seating, Drs. Carlos J. Finlay and
Juan Guiteras. Standing up, Drs. Alfredo Dominguez Roldan,
Aristides Agramonte, Taylor, Antonio Diaz Albertini (myself)
an American visitor whose name I am not aware of, and Dr.
Hugo Roberts, presently Chief of the Quarantine Department
of Cuba.--Dr. Antonio Diaz Albertini.”
div1.closer: Sincerely, P. S. Hench, M. D. psh:ds
